intro: Eupritchardia pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific eupritchardia, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and other related genera. This plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
